title: headingnorth
author: headingnorth
created_time: February 28, 2025, 06:54:24 PMLast edit: March 01, 2025, 01:35:31 AM by headingnorth
content: Con artists always begin by telling you something you know to be true, before pulling a bait and switch on you. Trump attended the bitcoin conference to tell the world bitcoin is great and how much he loves bitcoin. But after winning the election he starts his own shitcoin pump and dump and begins promoting a bunch of other crap. That is called a bait and switch. The President of Argentina pulled off the same shit. That is how they hide behind the mask of bitcoin. They tell you what you want to hear to get elected (bitcoin is great!). But once in office they do something completely different (start their own shitcoin pump and dump). That is basically how every altcoin starts off. The promoters always tell you how great and wonderful bitcoin is (which is true) before trying to convince you to invest in their shitcoin.And the suckers fall for it every single time. You can't trust any of these shitcoin charlatans. The only thing you can trust in is bitcoin. Trump promised that he would use the bitcoin currently held by the US Govt. to start a bitcoin reserve or stockpile, but after he took office the bitcoin went missing.I would not be surprised if it has been embezzled by him and his cronies, which it probably was. Doesn't matter which party is in power, they are all totally corrupt.

comments.author: death69
comments.body: People still expect politicians to have principles. That’s the real shit. Bitcoin isn’t a political movement because it’s an exit from politics. The moment you attach it to a leader, you’re setting yourself up for betrayal. Milei, Trump doesn’t matter. The game is simple: they ride the wave for attention, make promises they’ll never keep, and redirect the hype into their own scams. This isn’t an accident. This is the function of power.Bitcoin is the antithesis of these systems, and that’s why they can’t touch it. Thus they pretend to embrace it, hoping you’ll fall for the illusion. But every time you look to a government for Bitcoin’s future, you’re missing the entire point. They don’t own Bitcoin. They never will. They can print laws, print lies, print fear but they can’t print Bitcoin.The real con is expecting honesty from people who operate in deception. And the biggest red flag is the moment someone praises Bitcoin but tries to sell you something else. That’s when you walk away. No exceptions. No excuses. Bitcoin doesn’t need middlemen. It doesn’t need approval. It doesn’t need promises. It just needs people to wake up and stop looking for saviors.
